content:
I am reporting a problem that started about an hour ago:
This error was created by the template (00:20.0743)
IG Publisher finished with code 1
The HL7 IG Publisher failed. The HL7 IG Publisher tool is not developed as part of Trifolia-on-FHIR; it is developed by HL7. If you are still having issues after having reviewed and addressed ToF errors reported in the log above, go to chat.fhir.org to get more information on how to proceed.
I can't publish my IG in either the production or development version of Trifolia on FHIR. @Grahame Grieve
"Error code 1" is not terribly helpful. Does Trifolia expose the build log?

When using the HL7 template, the IG id must start with "hl7." - found sdoh-uc2
[xslt] XXXXXX-1lJc6ikVGhaYj/template/scripts/onGenerate.genProperties.xslt:24: Fatal Error! Processing terminated by xsl:message at line 24 in onGenerate.genProperties.xslt
[xslt] Failed to process XXXXXX-1lJc6ikVGhaYj/template/onGenerate-ig-updated.xml
Publishing Content Failed: Fatal error during transformation using XXXXXX-1lJc6ikVGhaYj/template/scripts/onGenerate.genProperties.xslt: Processing terminated by xsl:message at line 24 in onGenerate.genProperties.xslt; SystemID: file:/tmp/tmp-1lJc6ikVGhaYj/template/scripts/onGenerate.genProperties.xslt; Line#: 24; Column#: -1 (00:19.0200)
(00:19.0201)
This error was created by the template (00:19.0202)
IG Publisher finished with code 1
The HL7 IG Publisher failed. The HL7 IG Publisher tool is not developed as part of Trifolia-on-FHIR; it is developed by HL7. If you are still having issues after having reviewed and addressed ToF errors reported in the log above, go to chat.fhir.org to get more information on how to proceed.

@Natasha Kreisle per the logs above, you need to set the "package id" of the implementation to something that starts with "hl7." in order to use the official hl7 template
When using the HL7 template, the IG id must start with "hl7." - found sdoh-uc2

You can change this in Browse/Edit > "Implementation Guide", on the "General" tab.
It is the field labeled "Package Id" on the right side of the screen.
note that when you make that change, you will also have to specify the "HL7 Work Group" field
